definition: to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
way/route/road
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
variant of 廢|废[fei4]/disabled

sentences.english: So don't give up in the middle.
So all I had behind me was incompleteness and disappointment.
sentences.chinese: 于是我所剩的，只是半途而废和失望沮丧。

sentences.english: To half-do anything is to make failure of it.
sentences.chinese: 任何事情半途而废就是失败。

sentences.english: The only one stopping you is YOU, so don’t let that happen!
sentences.chinese: 唯一能阻止你的就是你自己，所以千万不要半途而废。

sentences.english: They let prevention fall by the wayside.
sentences.chinese: 它们使预防工作半途而废。

sentences.english: However, let me be paranoid here and draw your attention to the usual disclaimer.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我偏执地猜测，你们通常会放弃或半途而废。

sentences.english: All that you do, do with your might; things done by halves are never done right. –R. H. Stoddard.
sentences.chinese: 做一切事情都要尽力而为，半途而废永远不行。

sentences.english: Thus I must finish my funeral song; I must not leave it uncompleted .
sentences.chinese: 因此我必须完成我自己的丧曲，不能让它半途而废。

sentences.english: So keep looking until you find it. Don’t settle.
sentences.chinese: 所以，继续寻找，直到找到为止，不要半途而废。

sentences.english: Perseverance is the antidote for unfinished work, James says.
sentences.chinese: 雅各说，忍耐是防止半途而废的妙法。

sentences.english: I'm worried that you would stop studying.
sentences.chinese: 我很担心你在学习上会半途而废。

sentences.english: If you try to handle too many objectives per month, they all suffer.
sentences.chinese: 如果你每月里有太多目标，这些目标将会半途而废。

sentences.english: Somewhere along the line they begin to avoid becoming self-responsible.
sentences.chinese: 失败者半途而废，在中途就开始不对自己负责了。

sentences.english: Dreamers are not content with being merely mediocre, because no one ever dreams of going halfway.
sentences.chinese: 梦想家不甘平庸，因为没有人想半途而废。

sentences.english: Reform has not completely petered out.
sentences.chinese: 改革并没有完全半途而废。

definition: lit. to fish for three days and sun-dry the nets for two days (proverb)/fig. not to persevere in doing sth/to do sth by fits and starts
pinyin: san1 tian1 da3 yu2 , liang3 tian1 shai4 wang3

definition: anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
in two minds about sth (idiom)/half-hearted/shilly-shallying
to start but not finish (idiom); to fail to carry things through/lack of sticking power/short attention span
brief period of enthusiasm/flash in the pan
to pursue unremittingly (idiom); to persevere
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/lack of sticking power/short attention span
lit. to beat the return drum (idiom)/fig. to give up/to turn tail
to press on
downhearted/downcast/in despair
to procrastinate
perseverance
to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
lit. tiger's head, snake's tail (idiom); fig. a strong start but weak finish
to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
